review_title: Most employees are looking to leave
pros: They pay me. Not much, but better than nothing. The cafe' isn't too bad for a hospital cafe. And it's small enough that everyone seems to know each other at least a little bit
cons: The management is horrendous is a good place to start. They do not care about the employees at all. HR is a joke, and everyone knows it. Everyone I speak to is dissatisfied working here. Also, the only reason I would be a patient at this hospital is because I get an employee discount (and most parts of the health insurance offered can only be done there), and I still would rather be treated elsewhere. Supposedly things will change after the acquisition happens with Duke Lifepoint, but I'm not optimistic

job_title: Lab Technician/Medical Assistant in Sims, NC
pros: I have lived here all of my life and think that Wilson Medical Center is a very good hospital. No hospital is perfect and no physician is perfect.
cons: I can't think of any downsides. I need to find a job and I know several people that work; or have worked there and have had no complaints.
Poor management, poor training, employees not treated like they are valued, no wage increases

pros: Awesome teamwork, great personalities, physicians are competent, and you are more than just a number. I have studied at two other hospitals and this is by far better than others in the area to work at.
cons: Nurse:patient ratio is higher than recommended. The building is outdated, but that is being remedied. Medical benefits are sufficient but could be better.

review_title: Stay for one to two years, then look for better pay & working conditions
